memberdef.name: LV_LOG_LEVEL_TRACE
memberdef.initializer: 0 /*A lot of logs to give detailed information*/

memberdef.name: LV_LOG_LEVEL_WARN
memberdef.initializer: 2 /*Log if something unwanted happened but didn't caused problem*/

memberdef.name: LV_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR
memberdef.initializer: 3 /*Only critical issue, when the system may fail*/

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* lv_log_print_g_cb_t) (lv_log_level_t level, const char *, uint32_t, const char *)
memberdef.argsstring: )(lv_log_level_t level, const char *, uint32_t, const char *)
memberdef.name: lv_log_print_g_cb_t

detaileddescription.para: Log print function. Receives "Log Level", "File path", "Line number" and "Description".

Register custom print/write function to call when a log is added. It can format its "File path", "Line number" and "Description" as required and send the formatted log message to a consol or serial port.
print_cb
a function pointer to print a log

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_log_level_t level, const char *file, int line, const char *dsc)
memberdef.name: lv_log_add

detaileddescription.para:
Add a log
level
the level of log. (From lv_log_level_t enum)
file
name of the file when the log added
line
line number in the source code where the log added
dsc
description of the log
